parameters: \pop[2]I enter the Triple R, and my hunger and thirst is immediately apparent.
\pop[2]It has a distinct smell, but it's a good one. Definitely loosens up the wallet.
\pop[2]Speaking of that old expression, I'd be meeting Dante for lunch today.
\pop[2]He was the only person I knew that still carried around a wallet.
\pop[2]A bit old-fashioned, especially when everything is forced onto our phones.
\pop[2]But I guess it could still be useful for something. Whatever that something could be.
\pop[2]I eventually find him sitting at a table in the back corner.
\pop[2]That's not where I expected to see him. We all kind of have a "usual" table.
\pop[2]But I guess we weren't here as a group. It was just me and him.
\pop[2]My one-on-one time has been kind of limited so far, actually.
\pop[2]It was nice to be able to see my friends outside of our group dynamic.
\pop[2]If anything, stuff like this would only serve to make our group dynamic stronger.
\pop[2]He notices me, and waves me over. Things get off to a quick start.
\pop[2]He's typing away at a laptop in front of him, but multitasking seems to be no issue.
\pop[2]Since I wondered about it moments ago, I ask him about why he has a wallet.
\pop[4]Most people tend to start with a greeting, Delta.
But I guess I'm just too cool for people to follow the rules.
And if you must know, it was a gift from my father.
\pop[2]Oh, that makes sense. It's just a relic of a simpler time.
\pop[4]Basically, he told me that we should never forget where we came from.
I don't really know how a hand-me-down wallet helps with that, though.
It might be one of those things that only makes sense to old people.
\pop[2]He laughs, before closing his laptop. I guess work was over now.
\pop[4]Sorry about that. You never know when a good idea might hit you.
It's a total lifesaver, carrying around something I can jot notes in.
In fact, I owe a couple of my best-selling ideas to this thing.
\pop[2]Sounds like being a writer is tough.
\pop[2]I hadn't even considered the possibility of forgetting your own ideas.
\pop[2]But all of a sudden, I'm mad at the thought. I can imagine how much it would suck.
\pop[2]He reaches for a cup, and takes a large swig of coffee.
\pop[4]Honestly, I used to hate the stuff.
I wanted my day to start when I got out of bed.
But all the work just made it harder and harder for me.
\pop[2]I remember Taylor mentioning something different in the nightclub.
\pop[2]Something about a contest that turned him into an addict...?
\pop[2]Dante immediately blushes, and looks away from me.
\pop[4]Gotta be honest, I was hoping you forgot that one.
If Taylor is good at \c[14]one\c[0] thing, it's embarrassing me.
\pop[2]I've wanted to win contests, too. It's nothing embarrassing.
\pop[2]Those companies can throw around a life-changing amount of money.
This wasn't a contest for money.
The prize was a once-in-a-lifetime experience.
\i[3]"Oh, interesting. Like a trip around the world...?"
\i[3]"Oh, interesting. Like a trip around the world...?"
\pop[2]He's being extremely vague. Why is this so embarrassing for him?
\pop[2]I tell him that he has nothing to worry about. I won't be judging him.
\pop[4]Fine, fine. But I'm only doing this to beat Taylor to the punch.
Something tells me he's just waiting to drop this one on you.
\pop[2]He rubs the back of his head, and lets out a nervous laugh.
\pop[4]It was Klace. I used to be a huge fan.
Well, I guess I still am; but I really wanted to meet him.
He had this brand of energy drink, and used it to launch a contest.
\pop[4]Find the winning can, and you'd get to go on tour with him.
I guess I thought that traveling the world with a popstar would be inspiring.
I didn't win, though. I just ended up with a crippling addiction to caffeine.
\pop[2]I didn't realize Klace had his own brand of enery drink.
\pop[2]That's pretty extra. So is the entire idea of the contest, to be honest.
\pop[2]But on the other hand, it'd drive sales, and give him more exposure.
If he finds out, then he'll know I've been putting on an act.
I tried to be all oblivious, like I didn't really know who he was.
\pop[2]Suddenly, a lot of stuff about last week made more sense.
\pop[2]At the club, Dante was the first one to speak to Klace when we got upstairs.
\pop[2]And not only that, but when we were pregaming, Dante suggested the music.
\pop[5]We've got ourselves a secret little fanboy, don't we...?
\i[6]"I'm going to bug you about this every day."
Knew I could count on you.
\i[6]"I'm going to bug you about this every day."
Besides, \c[14]one\c[0] Taylor is already more than enough.
\pop[4]But I think I saw people start to turn and look.
Maybe we should change the subject...?
\pop[2]Right. Klace requested that we offer him privacy while he was here.
\pop[2]At least Dante got what he wanted in the end. The chance to meet someone he admired.
\pop[2]I sit and wait, deciding to let him come up with whatever we'd talk about next.
\pop[4]Well, last time we talked, I remember I was working on my book.
You'll be happy to know that progress has quite literally exploded.
I guess it was only a matter of time before the floodgates opened.
\pop[4]That's kind of how I operate, though.
I could go months without working, and it'd be no big deal.
But once that ball is rolling, I have no problem making up for the lost time.
\pop[2]I'm pretty sure that's common for people who make their own hours.
\pop[2]As long as he gets the job done, he's free to handle it however he wants.
\pop[4]Suddenly that twelve month deadline doesn't seem too bad.
In fact, I've even started thinking about what I want to do next.
There's a whole world out there, and I've been locked in a room.
\pop[4]Maybe one day. But I gotta start small.
I was actually thinking of reconnecting with some family.
Believe it or not, my life doesn't \c[14]fully\c[0] revolve around Isaac.
\pop[4]Though I'm starting to think that \c[14]yours\c[0] might.
I mean, he told me that you two were gonna try dating.
That probably means you'll be getting closer to me, too.
\i[2]"Doesn't bother me, I could easily handle both of you."
\i[5]"The more friends, the merrier. No problem at all."
\i[6]"I'm afraid I've reached my 'snarky' friend quota, actually."
\i[2]"Doesn't bother me, I could easily handle both of you."
You know, you're starting to remind me of Taylor.
And I don't mean that as an insult this time. Probably.
\i[5]"The more friends, the merrier. No problem at all."
I always thought our group dynamic was special.
It's nice to know that your arrival made it even \c[14]more\c[0] special.
\i[6]"I'm afraid I've reached my 'snarky' friend quota, actually."
\pop[4]Trust me, I have a lot more to offer than that~
Play your cards right, and maybe you'll find out one day.
I don't think Isaac would mind. In fact, I know he wouldn't.
\pop[2]He strikes a thinking pose for a few moments before speaking again.
\pop[4]I remember telling you that I basically grew up in a library.
Well, I meant that literally. The librarian let me stay there when I needed it.
So when things got rough at home, I'd just go get lost in a good book.
\pop[4]But things at home kinda got worse as time went on.
So before I knew it, the library became my entire life.
They sheltered me while I learned to read, and write.
\pop[4]I can definitely look back and say it was worth it.
But at the time, it definitely seemed like the worst thing ever.
I wrote a bunch of "woe is me" stories, to attempt self-pity.
\pop[4]Eventually, some of them found their way into anthologies.
That was the first step. People kept saying how good my stuff was.
I got an agent to help me with all the publishing offers that came my way.
\pop[4]But that's the thing. I've been working ever since.
Haven't had much time to take care of "Dante" things.
But after this next book, my whole life is wide open.
\pop[2]Growing up in a library sounds like it could be pretty awesome.
\pop[2]I wish it could've happened for him without the issues back at home.
\pop[4]Bet you didn't expect me to be a runaway.
A lot of people don't. They act surprised, or shower me in sympathy.
But I don't need any of that. I think I'm doing really well for myself.
I mean, I feel like I've accomplished quite a bit.
Maybe enough for my family to let bygones be bygones.
\i[5]"I'm sure they're counting down the days until you call."
\i[2]"You've accomplished a lot. It's kind of infatuating."
\i[1]"I'm sure they'd be happy to reconnect with you."
\i[5]"I'm sure they're counting down the days until you call."
It's been so long, we're all gonna be different people.
But you know what? I think that's what we needed. Change.
\i[2]"You've accomplished a lot. It's kind of infatuating."
\pop[4]Oh, come on. You're starting to sound like my inbox.
But it's nice to know that you're at least a \c[14]little\c[0] taken with me.
We'll have to talk about that more sometime. It's totes mutual.
\i[1]"I'm sure they'd be happy to reconnect with you."
\pop[4]Yeah, I know I'm just being paranoid.
It's been so long, there's no way any of us still hold a grudge.
I was just a dumb kid back then. One who thought he knew everything.
\pop[4]Of course, I need to finish this book before I do anything major.
Unless any impatience gets the better of me. Which it will.
Either way, I just hope you'll have my back.
\pop[2]I nod, and tell him he's right.
\pop[2]I'd always have his back, especially now that he's opening up to me.
\pop[2]It's weird. I learned more about him in one sitting than I ever have before.
\pop[2]A runaway novelist who grew up in a library...?
\pop[2]A fractured relationship with his family, and a renowned bibliography?
\pop[2]I really need to do something with my life.
\pop[4]Well, I gotta say, thanks for the chat.
I hope we can do this again. Maybe on New Year's Eve?
You have four midnights, after all. If I don't get one, I'll be offended~
\pop[2]He smirks at me, and our time at the Triple R came to an end.
\pop[2]He's right, though. Because of The Quantum Leap, I'll have four midnights.
\pop[2]And not only that, but I have four new friends. Isaac, Taylor, Dante, and Klace.
\pop[2]Things were definitely gonna be interesting on the 31st.
